member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FillBeziers(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Draws a series of filled, cubic Bezier splines each defined by start, end and two control points. The ending point of the previous curve is used as starting point for the next. Therfore the inital curve needs four points and the subsequent 3 (2 control and 1 end point).
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, cx1, cy1, cx2, cy2, x2, y2, cx3, cx4 ..., xn, yn).

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FillBeziers(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Int32)

member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, cx1, cy1, cx2, cy2, x2, y2, cx3, cx4 ..., xn, yn).

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.FillCurve(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Single,System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Draws a filled Cardinal spline (cubic) defined by a point collection. The cardinal spline passes through each point in the collection.
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, x4, y4, x1, x2 ..., xn, yn).
The tension of the curve defines the shape. Usually between 0 and 1. 0 would be a straight line.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.DrawBeziers(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Draws a series of cubic Bezir splines each defined by start, end and two control points. The ending point of the previous curve is used as starting point for the next. Therfore the inital curve needs four points and the subsequent 3 (2 control and 1 end point).
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, cx1, cy1, cx2, cy2, x2, y2, cx3, cx4 ..., xn, yn).

member.name: M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmapExtensions.DrawCurve(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WriteableBitmap,System.Int32[],System.Single,System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Draws a Cardinal spline (cubic) defined by a point collection. The cardinal spline passes through each point in the collection.
member.param: The points for the curve in x and y pairs, therefore the array is interpreted as (x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, x4, y4, x1, x2 ..., xn, yn).
The tension of the curve defines the shape. Usually between 0 and 1. 0 would be a straight line.
